node.text: Satellite data shows that cities have hotter average surface temperatures than surrounding areas. Pollution, asphalt, and lack of green spaces all contribute to what scientists call the "urban heat island effect." This extreme heat can have deadly consequences. The Verge science team hit New York’s streets with a thermal camera to learn just how hot cities can get, and why.

node.title: We took the temperature of New York’s hottest neighborhoods

node.text: iOS 15 and iPadOS 15 are Apple’s latest and greatest operating systems, and the public beta gives a first look at new features like SharePlay, Focus modes, improved iPad multitasking, and more.

node.title: iOS 15 preview: the good, the bad, and the weird

node.text: Have you ever listened to a neuron? One way neuroscientists learn about the brain is by analyzing recordings of synaptic activity. One scientist is taking it a step further by turning data from those recordings into music. The Verge Science team joined Simón(e) Sun in the lab — and the recording studio — to create a song out of a brain cell.

node.title: How this scientist makes music from brain signals

node.text: Sony’s top-of-the-line Alpha 1 mirrorless camera checks every spec box and comes with every feature. It’s one of the most capable cameras you can buy. We hit up one of NYC’s fastest cyclists, @terrybarentsen, to see how well it can keep up under pressure.

node.title: Can the Sony A1 keep up with NYC?

node.text: Bismuth has been around for thousands of years, yet it’s only been used in a handful of applications — and mostly to treat stomach ailments. But as the world looks for cleaner and safer energy, bismuth might soon become the star of the heavy metals family.

node.title: This alien-like metal may one day power your electronics

node.text: Super73 and Juiced are two California companies that make super-fast, moped-style e-bikes that are incredibly popular right now. We thought it would be interesting to take two of their highest spec models — Super73’s RX and Juiced’s HyperScrambler 2 — and see how they stack up against each other. And of course, we raced them too. Which do you think won?

node.title: Super73 v Juiced: Racing two extremely powerful e-bikes

node.text: The best demo at Apple's WWDC 2021 was Universal Control, a feature that lets you use your Mac's keyboard on an iPad and even a second Mac. It's a very clever little feature, but it is built on years of small iPad improvements.

node.text: Sony’s new WF-1000XM4 wireless earbuds have powerful noise cancellation that rivals over-ear headphones. They offer fantastic sound quality with support for the LDAC codec and beat competitors like the AirPods Pro and Bose QuietComfort Earbuds in battery life. Are these the new noise-canceling buds to get?

node.title: Sony WF-1000XM4 review: silence to my ears

node.text: Trees move. They’ve been slowly migrating to new habitats since the last ice age. But these days, they’re having trouble keeping up with climate change, leaving park agencies and forest managers with tough decisions. The Verge Science team went into the woods with an ecophysiologist — and her shotgun — to learn how and why trees migrate, and why it matters.

node.title: This scientist shoots trees to study how they migrate

node.text: As Epic Games pushed to get back into the iOS App Store, a lot of secrets came out, including surprising details about Microsoft’s cloud gaming strategy and the future of Fortnite.

node.title: Epic v. Apple trial was much bigger than Fortnite

node.text: The all-new 2021 iPad Pro has Apple's latest M1 processor, originally designed for the MacBook Air. The 12.9-inch version also has an incredible Mini LED screen, making it the best thing for watching movies that isn't a TV. But for all that, is it still an iPad? Dieter Bohn reviews.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 28, 2021. May be an image of indoor.

node.text: What’s on your desk, Andrew Marino? The Verge’s senior audio director is responsible for producing almost everything that you hear in our podcasts. We asked him to show us his desks. Andrew keeps one in his living room for work and another in his bedroom for personal projects. His tech ranges from modern to old-school with a MacBook Pro, an Akai MPK mini MIDI controller, a cassette player, and a Panasonic camera that serves as a webcam. He also keeps fun toys and decorations like a cat piano hanging on his wall and a crayon tape player!

node.text: Whether you want to stream or record console games on PC, or link up a camera to use as a webcam, Genki’s ShadowCast is a serviceable option that doesn’t cost too much at $45, and it offers a clever Arcade app via browser. Link in bio for full review. Photo by: @cam.faulkner

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 26, 2021. May be an image of wrist watch and text that says '大 × Music 12:18 12:18AM AM ロ Notifications O Alarms'.

node.text: Virtually every smartwatch now uses touchscreens, but it didn’t use to be this way. The Pebble was the last stand for hardware buttons on smartwatches. But, like the company, the idea has fallen by the wayside. Overall, though, the Pebble’s design made it a joy to use. The relatively simple nature of its input method also meant that the Pebble’s software was similarly streamlined, cutting down cumbersome menus in favor of simpler displays. Photos by: @holowatyrose

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 26, 2021. May be an image of wrist watch and text that says '大 × Music 12:18 12:18AM AM ロ Notifications O Alarms'.
Photo by The Verge on July 26, 2021. May be an image of wrist watch and saddle-stitched leather.
Photo by The Verge on July 25, 2021. May be an image of screen, laptop and outdoors.

node.text: The new Framework Laptop is designed to be a DIY dream. Not only are its internal components like RAM, storage, and mainboard replaceable, but users can also customize the bezels, keyboard, and ports. Outside of its customizability, the Framework is a fairly standard productivity ultraportable. The value of this laptop hinges on future support, though. It starts at $1,399 with DIY kits starting at $749. Photo by: @monicawchin

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 24, 2021. May be an image of phone, screen and text that says '15:04 Bitwarden Monday 15:04 19July 19 19 July Authy Twitter จะ Maps Photos Slack G BBC WEATHER 19 BBC Calendar Gmail Weather l Play Store'.

node.text: The OnePlus Nord 2 is the company’s latest midrange smartphone. It feels much more like a stripped down flagship than its predecessor, but its limited focus means it does a great job at delivering where it counts. All the core essentials are still there: a vibrant high refresh rate screen, good battery life, and easy-to-use software. The OnePlus Nord 2 starts at £399 / €399.

node.text: Apple’s MagSafe Battery Pack doesn’t provide a lot of juice, but it sure is nice to use.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 22, 2021. May be an image of phone, screen and text that says '2:08 0R 83% 2:08 PM Monday, J12 ® 6:00 Game enhancer Music Google Play Store Multi-windo Assistant Cinema Pro G'.

node.text: The Sony Xperia 1 III offers a good 6.5-inch OLED with a smooth 120Hz refresh rate, a Snapdragon 888 processor, and three rear cameras including a zoom lens with two focal lengths. It’s a very good high-end device, but it’s too costly to recommend at $1,300. Photo by: @allisonjo1

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 21, 2021. May be an image of laptop, screen and indoor.

node.text: Gigabyte’s Aero 15 is one of the most powerful OLED laptops you can get, and it has a flashy RGB keyboard to boot. But there are some significant downsides, especially the battery life. The life span isn't great, especially because the laptop sits around the $2,000 mark. Photo by: @monicawchin

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 20, 2021. May be art.

node.text: The new $200 Symfonisk picture frame with Wi-Fi speaker from Ikea and Sonos puts impressive sound quality right on your wall. This wall art can play music from nearly any audio streaming service, and if you buy two, they can be surrounds for a Sonos Arc or Beam. Photo by: @chriswelch

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 20, 2021. May be art.
Photo by The Verge on July 20, 2021.
Photo by The Verge on July 19, 2021.

node.text: Razer’s new $99.99 wireless gaming headset, the Barracuda X, is a multiplatform model that can connect to consoles and devices with its USB-C wireless receiver. It also supports USB-A to maximize compatibility. Photo by: @cam.faulkner

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 18, 2021. May be an image of phone, screen and text that says 'Discover Alexa Communicate Smart Hom Music Video Routines Alarms Set reminder Take as'.

node.text: Amazon’s second-generation Echo Show 8 looks identical to its predecessor, but it comes with a faster processor and more capable camera. It’s still the best smart display in the Alexa ecosystem. It �sells for $129.99. Photo by: @danseifert

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Verge on July 17, 2021. May be an image of phone and text that says 'HASSELBLAD E+'.

node.text: OnePlus was recently caught doing the previously unthinkable — throttling the performance of its new flagship smartphone, the OnePlus 9 Pro. The company �is doubling down on its excuse for secretly throttling apps on the OnePlus 9 Pro phone, by arguing it was optimizing for battery life. That’s problematic, and we shouldn’t normalize it. Photo by: @becca.farsace
